io.github.twosquirrels.httpasfunctions

Class HttpAsFunctions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.twosquirrels.httpasfunctions.HttpAsFunctions

  • public class HttpAsFunctions
extends Object
    HTTP as Functions library Use Gson, Spark and OkHttp3. Require Gson.
    Version:
    1.3.0
    Author:
    TwoSquirrels

    • Method Detail

      • makeFunc

        public static void makeFunc(int port,
                            String name,
                            UnaryOperator<com.google.gson.JsonElement> function)
        Make a new interprocess or internet function. add function example:
         
 makeFunc(8080, "add", args -> {
   JsonObjectArgs jsonObjectArgs = new JsonObjectArgs(args);
   return new JsonPrimitive(jsonObjectArgs.getAsFloat("x") + jsonObjectArgs.getAsFloat("y"));
 });
        Parameters:
        port - port to put the function to make
        name - function name
        function - function to make

      • callFunc

        public static com.google.gson.JsonElement callFunc(int port,
                                                   String name,
                                                   com.google.gson.JsonElement request)
                                            throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   NullPointerException,
                                                   IOException,
                                                   com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException,
                                                   IllegalStateException,
                                                   HaFException
        Call an interprocess function.
        Parameters:
        port - the port(ex:8080) where the function to call is
        name - the function name
        request - the function argument JsonElement
        Returns:
        return value JsonElement of the return value of the function
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Avoid this exception by calling HttpUrl.parse(java.lang.String); it returns null for invalid URLs.
        NullPointerException - when response body is null.
        IOException - If the request could not be executed due to cancellation, a connectivity problem or timeout. Becau/e networks can fail during an exchange, it is possible that the remote server accepted the request before the failure.
        com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - When the JSON conversion of the response fails.
        IllegalStateException - When the call has already been http request executed.
        HaFException - When the response is error format.

      • callFunc

        public static com.google.gson.JsonElement callFunc(String host,
                                                   boolean secure,
                                                   int port,
                                                   String name,
                                                   com.google.gson.JsonElement request)
                                            throws IllegalArgumentException,
                                                   NullPointerException,
                                                   IOException,
                                                   com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException,
                                                   IllegalStateException,
                                                   HaFException
        Call an internet function.
        Parameters:
        host - the host(ex:"localhost") where the function to call is
        port - the port(ex:8080) where the function to call is
        secure - whether it is "https"
        name - the function name
        request - the function argument JsonElement
        Returns:
        return value JsonElement of the return value of the function
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Avoid this exception by calling HttpUrl.parse(java.lang.String); it returns null for invalid URLs.
        NullPointerException - when response body is null.
        IOException - If the request could not be executed due to cancellation, a connectivity problem or timeout. Becau/e networks can fail during an exchange, it is possible that the remote server accepted the request before the failure.
        com.google.gson.JsonSyntaxException - When the JSON conversion of the response fails.
        IllegalStateException - When the call has already been http request executed.
        HaFException - When the response is error format.
